items.content_html:
Motivation for this change

The SDDM display manager wants access to the .face.icon files stored in user home directories. Currently, this is not possible because systemd-tmpfiles resets the access permissions for home directories of users with createHome = true every reboot.

This PR simply gives SDDM the required access rights for all "normal" users.

items.content_html:
Motivation for this change

Currently setting a profile picture in SDDM can be done either by placing a file in the home directory or by install a package into the system environment with a special path that SDDM knows about (/share/sddm/faces). This allows explicitly setting user pictures through a NixOS module option.

Things done
  • Tested using sandboxing (nix.useSandbox on NixOS, or option sandbox in nix.conf on non-NixOS)
